intro: Erigeron crispulus, commonly known as the curlyleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has finely serrated, silver-gray leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist soils along stream banks and wet meadows. Erigeron crispulus produces small white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
